column5: Crossed quite a few of the list over the last couple years so have been adding new goals Big beautiful arctic char on tackle and or fly. Lake run steelhead and browns through the ice. Atlantics on the fly. Lakers over 20lbs plus any of the trout species I haven't tied into yet
Chris we should talk.. I just bought a 10wt setup and shooting head system last week for them, loaded a box of 9-12" flies too. If you're game let me know!

1.Ryabaga camp on the Ponoi River in Russia for Atlantic Salmon.  2.Ungava region of Quebec, flying into a different river every day via helicopter for arctic char and brook trout on rivers that almost never get fished.  #1 may be difficult to swing. On the plus side it looks as though #2 is going to happen in July 2016. Just the getting the final logistics pinned down as we speak.
One of these

I just bought a 10wt setup and shooting head system last week for them, loaded a box of 9-12" flies too. If you're game let me know!  I just so happen to know the perfect spot for em..  Keep in touch.

So with Jeremy84's lure thread it got me thinking to see what is everyone's dream fish.  Fish Bucket on their list to catch. It could be any species from anywhere in the world, and how what would you want to catch it on or with.  I actually have 3 and all different methods to catch them
Basically any species of trout besides lakers.  Zander  Frig anything I havent already caught really, its all fun!
50 inch musky.  Hopefully she follows right up to the boat before opening her mouth and chomping on my lure.  I always say she's out there and that we haven't crossed paths yet.

Musky on the fly. Sturgeon on the fly (don't ask how, I'm working on it). Roosterfish on the fly. Tuna over 100lbs on the fly. Striped bass over 10lbs on the fly. Golden Dorado on the fly. Hoping to cross off at least a couple this year.
My bucket list is to get DynamicBear so drunk that I can convince him that his bucket list was to noodle for Barracuda.
Please video tape this!
I want a halibut. I really just want to fry it up fresh out of the water. Its gotta be sooooo good!  S.
50 inch pike in ontario
Over a 50" musky  A nice big brown trout, don't care what size
The next one....
BIG grouper... And any and all billfish
Arctic Char Grayling Dolly Varden  Pretty much any salmonoid species
ON THE FLY! OH YA....
Most sot after fresh water game fish. Catching Ontario's record Yellow Perch.
I really big brook trout .... like 5 pounds or bigger.

I just want a Largemouth over 7lbs. I've been fishing hard since the end of 2009 after getting one just once away from 7. That's my goal to break the 7lb mark with a Largemouth Bass. After that it would be a 8lb, then a 9lb and so on....
Musky on the fly.  Chris we should talk..
Atlantic Salmon in Norway.  ON THE SPEY!!

Halibut.  I've been out for them several times, never caught one.  Had two very heavy fish on, but in one case a rubber hook, and the other he took me onto the bottom and broke me off.........  I even own a halibut rig, which resides on Vancouver Island and awaits my return!  And yes Sinker, fresh halibut is VERY tasty.  Doug
Halibut.   My sister-in-law is 4'10" and jigged up a 100 pounder off the coast of Alaska. She said it was just a tad difficult to get it to the boat
ON THE FLY! OH YA....  Of course!!! Bust out the 100 weight and foam seal topwater fly!!!!
50 inch musky on my own flies, getting closer each year, managed my pb 45 1/2 by 19 on the last day of the season Dec 15th, in 33.9 degree water
Local Waters - Musky, Laker, Whitefish, Channel Cat, Pike over 36"  Elsewhere - Dorado, Tuna, Sierra Mackerel, Arapaima, Alligator Gar. Oh and Piraiba Catfish
My actual list:  Sturgeon under my buddies dock. Whitefish (it wasn't until recently) Any trout on the fly Gar Paddlefish Blue Marlin (tops the list)
